perturbation.original_text: 26.1 Supplier shall at its own expense secure and continuously maintain, and shall require its Subcontractors to secure and continuously maintain, throughout the Term, the following insurance with companies qualified to do business in the jurisdiction in which the services will be performed and rating A-VII or better in the current Best's Insurance Reports published by A M. Best Company and shall, upon Bank of America's request, be furnished to Bank of America certificates and required endorsements evidencing such insurance. Bank of America shall be named as an ''Additional Insured" to the coverages described in Sections 26.2.3, 26.2.4, and 26.2.5 below for the purpose of protecting Bank of America from any expense and/or liability arising out of, alleged to arise out of, related to or connected with the Products provided by Supplier and/or its Subcontractors. The certificates shall state the amount of all deductibles and self-insured retentions and shall contain evidence that the policy or policies shall not be canceled or materially altered without at least thirty (30) calendar days prior written notice to Bank of America. Supplier and its Subcontractors shalt pay any and all costs which are incurred by Bank of America as a result of any such deductibles or self-insured retentions to the extent that Bank of America is named as an "Additional Insured," and to the same extent as if the policies contained no deductibles or self-insured retention. The insurance coverages and limits required to be maintained by Supplier and its Subcontractors shall be primary and non-contributory to insurance coverage, if any, maintained by Bank of America. Supplier and Proprietary to Bank of America its Subcontractors and their underwriters shall waive subrogation against Bank of America and shall cause their insurer(s) to waive subrogation against Bank of America.
perturbation.changed_text: 26.1 Supplier shall secure and maintain insurance with companies qualified to do business in the jurisdiction in which the services will be performed and shall, upon Bank of America's request, be furnished to Bank of America certificates evidencing such insurance. Bank of America may be named as an ''Additional Insured" to the coverages described in Sections 26.2.3, 26.2.4, and 26.2.5 below. The certificates shall state the amount of all deductibles and self-insured retentions and shall contain evidence that the policy or policies shall not be canceled or materially altered without prior written notice to Bank of America. The insurance coverages and limits required to be maintained by Supplier and its Subcontractors shall be primary to insurance coverage, if any, maintained by Bank of America. Supplier and Proprietary to Bank of America its Subcontractors and their underwriters shall waive subrogation against Bank of America and shall cause their insurer(s) to waive subrogation against Bank of America.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the insurance requirements by removing the 'at its own expense' clause, creating a potential ambiguity about who bears the cost of insurance. It also removes the requirement for subcontractors to maintain insurance, and eliminates the minimum A-VII rating requirement. Further, removing 'at least thirty (30) calendar days' creates a legal loophole, as the text doesn't provide a timeframe when there is cancellation or alterations to the policy, undermining Bank of America's protection. The removal of the 'non-contributory' aspect also undermines Bank of America.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding adequate insurance coverage and risk allocation; specific state insurance regulations in North Carolina regarding minimum coverage standards for businesses.

perturbation.original_text: 26.2.3 Commercial General Liability Insurance with a minimum combined single limit of liability of $1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 aggregate for bodily Injury, death, property damage and personal injury, and specifically covering infringement of Intellectual Property Rights. This policy shall include products/completed operations coverage and shall also include contractual liability coverage.
perturbation.changed_text: 26.2.3 Commercial General Liability Insurance with coverage for bodily Injury, death, property damage and personal injury. This policy shall include products/completed operations coverage and shall also include contractual liability coverage.
perturbation.explanation: This clause removes the minimum liability limits for Commercial General Liability Insurance and also gets rid of 'specifically covering infringement of Intellectual Property Rights', weakening the financial protection for Bank of America and creating a **legal contradiction** with standard business insurance requirements that mandate minimum coverage amounts for liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding adequate insurance coverage; specific state insurance regulations in North Carolina regarding minimum coverage standards for businesses.

perturbation.changed_text: 26.2.7 Supplier shall be responsible for loss to bank property and customer property, directly or indirectly, and shall maintain Fidelity Bond or Crime coverage for the dishonest acts of its employees. Bank of America shall be named as "Loss Payee, As Their Interest May Appear'' in such Fidelity Bond.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'in a minimum amount of $5,000,000' eliminates the minimum coverage amount for the Fidelity Bond or Crime coverage, increasing the risk to Bank of America. Deleting 'Supplier shall endorse such policy to include a "Client Coverage" or "Joint Payee Coverage" endorsement' removes the explicit requirement that bank of America be protected by the policy, increasing the legal risk for Bank of America. This omission introduces a **legal contradiction** with financial regulations that recommend or mandate specific minimum fidelity bond coverage for entities handling financial transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Deposit Insurance Act and related regulations regarding fidelity bonds for financial institutions; generally accepted risk management practices for financial institutions.
